info.name: Symphonia
info.description:
## error response if a request went wrong due to misuse or server error an error response will be sent it will have two fields
field description possible values
status it describes the source of the error if value is fail it means the error comes from the sender of the request else if its value was error it means it's a server error and should return for the back end developers to solve that issue error | fail
msg or message it contains information about the error which is safe to send to the user as it doesn't contain any sensetive data you have to be logged in!

item.name: Check if Users Follow a Playlist

header.description:
Required. A valid access token from the Spotify Accounts service: see the Web API Authorization Guide for details.
Following a playlist can be done publicly or privately. Checking if a user publicly follows a playlist doesnt require any scopes; if the user is publicly following the playlist, this endpoint returns true.
Checking if the user is privately following a playlist is only possible for the current user when that user has granted access to the playlist-read-private scope. See Using Scopes.

query.description: comma separated `Symphonia` ids for the document you want to check

variable.description: The `Symphonia` id for the document you want to retrieve

Checking if the user is privately following a playlist is only possible for the current user when that user has granted access to the playlist-read-private scope. See Using Scopes.

request.description:
## Patch user queue to be repeated or not
 change the state of the user repeat queue .


 it toggle the repeat queue property when requested
## Response Format
  On success, the HTTP status code in the response header is 204 no content, the header status code is an error code and the response body contains an error object.

## Patch user queue to be repeat a specific track or not.
 change the state of the user repeat Once queue .


 it toggle the repeat Once queue property when requested
 
 ## Response Format
  On success, the HTTP status code in the response header is 204 no content, the header status code is an error code and the response body contains an error object.

## Patch user queue to be shuffled or not
 change the state of the user shuffle queue .


 it toggle the shuffle queue property when requested
 
 ## Response Format
  On success, the HTTP status code in the response header is 204 no content, the header status code is an error code and the response body contains an error object.

## Patch user queue to save seek of current playing track
   just save the seek

 ## Response Format
  On success, the HTTP status code in the response header is 204 no content, the header status code is an error code and the response body contains an error object.

## Post user to next track in queue

 it put current and next and previous track in new postions and return all tracks when succes
 
 
 ## Response Format
  On success, the HTTP status code in the response header is 200 OK, the header status code is an error code and the response body contains an error object.
  
## Track_url_in_Queue
  | KEY  |  VALUE TYPE |  VALUE DESCRIPTION |
|---|---|---|
| data  |  Array of string |  The url of tracks in queue |

## Post user to previous track in queue

 it put current and next and previous track in new postions and return all tracks when succes
 
 ## Response Format
  On success, the HTTP status code in the response header is 200 OK, the header status code is an error code and the response body contains an error object.
  
## Track_url_in_Queue
  | KEY  |  VALUE TYPE |  VALUE DESCRIPTION |
|---|---|---|
| data  |  Array of string |  The url of tracks in queue |

request.description:
## Get user Track and Play it

 send the track in pakects to be played in partial content 
 
  
## First Scenario
  | KEY     	|  VALUE TYPE       |  VALUE DESCRIPTION											|
  |-------------|-------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------|
  | contextId   |  MongoDb ObjectId |  The Id of the context that you want to play that track from  |
  | context_url |  String           |  The Url of the context that you want to play that track from |
  | context_type|  String           |  The type of the context that you want to play that track from|
  | device      |  String           |  The device name that the user use to play the track			|
  
 - This scenario when the user go to a playlist or almub and try to play a song in that context

## Secnod Scenario
  | KEY     	|  VALUE TYPE       |  VALUE DESCRIPTION											|
  |-------------|-------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------|
  | device      |  String           |  The device name that the user use to play the track			|
 
- This secario when the user use the add to queue feature	

## Response Format
  On success, the HTTP status code in the response header is 200 OK or 206 Partial content, the header status code is an error code and the response body contains an error object.

## Patch user queue volume
 Just to save the volume progress  .

## Response Format
  On success, the HTTP status code in the response header is 204 no content, the header status code is an error code and the response body contains an error object.

## Post user queue to add Track 
 Just add new Track to the user queue list when the user press add to queue  .

## Response Format
  On success, the HTTP status code in the response header is 200 OK, the header status code is an error code and the response body contains an error object.

## Delete track from queue 
 just remove track from the queue when the user press remove from queue  .

## Response Format
  On success, the HTTP status code in the response header is 204 no content, the header status code is an error code and the response body contains an error object.

## Get user Queue 
 Just get the Queue of the user in json format .


## Response Format
  On success, the HTTP status code in the response header is 200 OK , the header status code is an error code and the response body contains an error object.

## Get Currently Playing object from user queue 
 Just reurn the Currently Playing Object the contain the track_Url and the device currently playing it  .

## Response Format
  On success, the HTTP status code in the response header is 200 OK, the header status code is an error code and the response body contains an error object.

response.name: Get Random Recommendation

header.description: access_token
header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Authorization header generated by Postman.

query.description: Optional. A country: an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Provide this parameter if you want to narrow the list of returned categories to those relevant to a particular country. If omitted, the returned items will be globally relevant.

header.description: *Required*. A valid access token from the Symphonia Accounts service.

query.description:
*Required*.
Search query keywords and optional field filters and operators.
For example:
q=roadhouse%20blues.

*Required*.
Valid types are: *album* , *artist*, *playlist*, *category*, *profile* and *track*.

`Optional`. The maximum number of items to return. Default: 20. Minimum: 1.
Note: The limit is applied within each type, not on the total response.
For example, if the limit value is 3 and the type is artist,album, the response contains 3 artists and 3 albums
`Optional`. The index of the first item to return. Default: 0 (the first object). Use with `limit` to get the next set of items.

request.description:
`note`: send the keyword url encoded i.e. if the keyword contains a space replace it with %20 which is the url code for space
`example`: Tame impala -> Tame%20impala.

`note`: search is case insensetive.

response.name: Search with limit and offset

header.description: *Required*. A valid access token from the Symphonia Accounts service.

query.description:
*Required*.
Search query keywords and optional field filters and operators.
For example:
q=roadhouse%20blues.

*Required*.
A comma-separated list of item types to search across.
Valid types are: *album* , *artist*, *playlist*, and *track*.
Search results include hits from all the specified item types.
For example: q=name:abacab&type=album,track returns both albums and tracks with abacab included in their name.

*Optional*.
Maximum number of results to return.
Default: 20
Minimum: 1
Maximum: 50
Note: The limit is applied within each type, not on the total response.
For example, if the limit value is 3 and the type is artist,album, the response contains 3 artists and 3 albums

*Optional*.
The index of the first result to return.
Default: 0 (the first result).
Maximum offset (including limit): 2,000.
Use with limit to get the next page of search results.

*Required*.
A comma-separated list of item types to search across.
Valid types are: *album* , *artist*, *playlist*, and *track*.
Search results include hits from all the specified item types.
For example: q=name:abacab&type=album,track returns both albums and tracks with abacab included in their name.

*Optional*.
Maximum number of results to return.
Default: 20
Minimum: 1
Maximum: 50
Note: The limit is applied within each type, not on the total response.
For example, if the limit value is 3 and the type is artist,album, the response contains 3 artists and 3 albums

*Optional*.
The index of the first result to return.
Default: 0 (the first result).
Maximum offset (including limit): 2,000.
Use with limit to get the next page of search results.

query.description: comma separated ids of the albums you want to retrieve their data

request.description:
# Description

Get Symphonia catalog information for multiple tracks based on their Symphonia IDs.

# Response Format

On success, the HTTP status code in the response header is `200` OK and the response body contains an object whose key is tracks and whose value is an array of track objects in JSON format. Objects are returned in the order requested. If an object is not found, a null value is returned in the appropriate position. Duplicate ids in the query will result in duplicate objects in the response. On error, the header status code is an error code and the response body contains an error object.


## Track object

| KEY               | VALUE TYPE                            | VALUE DESCRIPTION                                                                                                              |
| ----------------- | ------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |

request.description:
# Description

Get Symphonia catalog information for a single track identified by its unique Symphonia ID.

# Response

On success, the HTTP status code in the response header is `200` OK and the response body contains a track object in JSON format. On error, the header status code is an error code and the response body contains an error object.


## Track object

| KEY               | VALUE TYPE                            | VALUE DESCRIPTION                                                                                                              |
| ----------------- | ------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| album             | an album object             | The album on which the track appears. The album object includes a link in href to full information about the album.            |
| artists           | an array of artist objects | The artists who performed the track. Each artist object includes a link in href to more detailed information about the artist. |
| available_markets | array of strings                      | A list of the countries in which the track can be played, identified by their ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code.                         |
| duration_ms       | integer                               | The track length in milliseconds.                                                                                              |
| explicit          | Boolean                               | Whether or not the track has explicit lyrics ( true = yes it does; false = no it does not OR unknown).                         |
| href              | string                                | A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the track.                                                            |
| id                | string                                | The Symphonia ID for the track.                                                                                                |
| name              | string                                | The name of the track.                                                                                                         |
| popularity        | integer                               |	The popularity of the track. The value will be between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular.The popularity of a track is a value between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular. The popularity is calculated by algorithm and is based, in the most part, on the total number of plays the track has had and how recent those plays are.                                                                                                                                |
| type              | string                                | The object type: track.                                                                                                      |


## Request parameters
